title: Brogan, Hoffman lead Lincoln runners
text:
Brogan, Hoffman lead Lincoln runners HTR Media 7:49 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Manitowoc Lincoln boys take fifth at Fond du Lac Invitational. Brogan, Hoffman lead Lincoln runners (Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto) 3 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
FOND DU LAC – Drew Hoffman and Erick Jansen posted a back-to-back finish in the top 20 to lead Manitowoc Lincoln to a fifth-place finish in the boys race at the Fond du Lac Invitational on Friday. 
Hoffman finished 15th and Jansen was 16th, while Ian Siebold followed close behind in 21st to lead the Ships. 
Macie Brogan led the way for the Lincoln girls with a 14th-place finish. The Ships finished 10 th among the 11 teams at the invite. 
Girls 
Team scores : Stevens Point 50, Neenah 84, Germantown 89, Fond du Lac 114, Appleton West 151, Appleton East 190, Menomonee Falls 202, Oshkosh North 206, Waukesha North 214, Manitowoc Lincoln 221, Sheboygan North 249 
Individual winner : Autum Shurbert Hetzel (SP), 18:42.5. 
ML : 14. Macie Brogan, 19:58.6; 38. Anna Peterman, 21:04.3; 41. Breanna Reinhart, 21:14.4; 70. Sam Schuetze, 22:34.2; 72. Isabel Stazny, 23:09.8. 
Boys 
Team scores : Homestead 53, Neenah 55, Germantown 69, Waukesha North 90, Manitowoc Lincoln 125, Fond du Lac 201, Sheboygan North 209, Appleton West 211, Appleton East 215, Menomonee Falls 232, Oshkosh North 321. 
Individual winner : Drew Bosley (HOME), 15:55.3. 
ML : 15. Drew Hoffman, 17:00.6; 16. Erick Jansen, 17:00.6; 21. Ian Siebold, 17:09.1; 30. William Diraimondo, 17:19.6; 44. Andrew Klavekoske, 17:54.3. 
Thursday preps 
Volleyball 
Manitowoc Lincoln 3, Bay Port 0: Cassidy Mrotek, Sarah Greene and Mallory Dixon all had double-doubles for the host Ships who won by scores 25-20, 25-21, 25-19. 
Mrotek had 16 digs and 10 kills while Greene added 15 digs and 10 kills and Dixon tallied 33 assists, 12 digs and four aces. 
Also for Lincoln, Katie Henry had nine kills and four blocks. 
Mishicot 3, Ozaukee 0: Alyssa Ahumada had 13 assists and six aces to lead the way for the Indians. 
Mishicot won by scores of 25-21, 25-22, 25-19. 
Also for the Indians, Teha Nguyen had six aces and five digs, Haley Liptow tallied five aces and four digs and Emily Baumgartner had four assists and seven digs. 
St. Mary Catholic 3, Reedsville 1: The visiting Panthers fell to the Zephyrs by scores of 25-23, 25-17, 22-25, 25-17. 
Kelsey Stadler had eight assists to lead Reedsville while Alexyss Schmidt had seven kills and Jenna Loefer and Brenna Kiekhaefer each tallied six digs. 
Random Lake 3, Manitowoc Lutheran 1: The host Lancers fell to the Rams by scores of 25-18, 25-21, 20-25, 25-22. 
Lutheran’s Lauren Griepentrog had a double double with 15 kills and 10 digs while Maddie Schleis tallied 29 digs. 
Also for the Lancers, Rachel Kluba had 15 assists, three digs and three aces and Hannah Schleis added 12 assists. 
Boys soccer 
De Pere 4, Manitowoc Lincoln 1: The Ships got a goal just before the half to tie the game at 1-1 but surrendered three goals in the second half for the loss. 
Tamirat Niedermeyer struck in the 44th minute for Lincoln unassisted after the Redbirds had pulled ahead in the 14th. 
Second half goals in the 65th, 72nd and 90th minutes were too much for Lincoln as the Ships were outshot 15-4. 
Owen Maurer made 11 saves for Lincoln in goal. 
Sturgeon Bay 13, Roncalli/Two Rivers 1 (60 min.): The visiting Jets were downed but were able to avoid the shutout right before the game was called for the mercy rule. 
Ben Oberbroeckling made a breakaway goal in the 58th minute to provide the co-op with a spark. 
Jon Gallenberger made six saves in goal for Roncalli, playing in the first half, while Nick Seidl made one stop in the second. 
Girls swimming 
Brillion/Valders/Chilton 120, Two Rivers/ Roncalli 47: BVC won 10 of 11 competitive events to top Two Rivers/Roncalli. 
Sammie Bonick and Ireland Fenlon each won two individual events to lead BVC. Bonick took finished first in the 100 butterfly and 500 freestyle while Fenlon did the same in the 200 IM and 100 freestyle. 
Jessica Hawki took first in 100 breaststroke to pace Two Rivers/Roncalli. 
200 Medley Relay — 1. Brillion/Valders/Chilton (Fenlon, Miller, Wollersheim, Bonick) 2:10.56, 200 freestyle — 1. Sydney Miller, BVC, 2:32.65 ; 200 IM — 1. Ireland Fenlon, BVC, 2:42.70; 50 Freestyle — Janet Koehler, BVC, 38.17; 100 butterfly — 1. Sammie Bonick, BVC, 1:13.55; 100 Freestyle — 1. Ireland Fenlon, BVC, 1:05.08; 500 freestyle — 1. Sammie Bonick, 6:03.95; 200 freestyle relay — 1. Brillion/ Valders/Chilton (Kratz, Appel, Frank, Fenlon) 100 backstroke — 1. Janet Koehler, BVC, 1:16.56; 100 breaststroke — Jessica Hawki, TR/R, 1:23.81 400 freestyle relay — 1. Brillion/Valders/Chilton (Koehler, Risse, Frank, Bonick) 4:25.15; 3 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://htrne.ws/1Rlx66P TOP VIDEOS
